item.title: What It Is Like to Be Nothing
item.description: Thomas Nagel once asked a simple question: “What is it like to be a bat?” The answer, he argued, was inaccessible to us. We can describe bat sonar in detail, map their neural circuits, understand the physics of echolocation â€” but the subjective experience, the feel of being a bat, remains forever beyond our reach. There’s something it is like to be a bat, and that something is closed to us.
